forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Cloudy then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between 2am and 4am. Cloudy, with a low around 36. Southwest wind around 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Rain Showers then Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers between 9am and 10am. Cloudy, with a high near 49. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As the echoes of the day fade, Boston settles into a chilly night, with a hint of moisture lingering in the air. The clouds stretch thick and heavy, cloaking the skyline in a shroud of gray. While rain showers linger in the forecast, their chances remain slight, and the wind whispers softly from the southwest, hinting at what tomorrow may bring. The temperature slips into the low thirties, an invitation to wrap oneself in layers for warmth, as the city glimmers with lights against the dark canvas above.

Come morning, the clouds will persist, painting the atmosphere in a subdued palette. Expect a continuation of overcast skies to greet the dawn, with just a faint opportunity for sporadic drizzles. A high near a cool forty-nine will define the day, making it a good one for light jackets and shawls, perfect for strolling along the Charles or sipping warm beverages in a café. There’s an understated beauty to these winter days; perhaps it’s the serenity found in the quieter streets, the muffled sounds of footsteps on wet pavement, or the cozy embrace of familiar indoor spaces. A day spent exploring small nooks of the city, perhaps visiting art galleries or indulging in a good book at a local library, would resonate well with the mood of the moment, where warmth and introspection take the lead.
